p: Morphological traits were not associated with temperature in the PRCS (rate of change: 0.060 ± 0.078 SD per °C; LRT: χ 2 = 0.6, df = 1, p = 0.443) and only marginally associated with temperature in the PRC dataset (rate of change: −0.053 ± 0.029 SD per °C; LRT: χ 2 = 3.3, df = 1, p = 0.068). Neither endothermy nor type of morphological measure (skeletal vs. body mass) moderated the relationship between morphological traits and temperature (Supplementary Data 2). Our analyses indicated, however, that taxa may moderate the effect of temperature on morphology in the PRC dataset (LRT: χ 2 = 4.5, df = 1, p = 0.11, Supplementary Data 2), with negative associations on average observed in mammals, and no strong association found in birds (Fig. 3).
